column5: Nov 4 Telecom components maker Anaren Inc  said it would be bought by a fund run by private equity investor Veritas Capital for about $381 million in cash.

column4: Boycott threatened after racial profiling claims at Macy's  Barneys
column5: NEW YORK The Reverend Al Sharpton and other civil rights leaders in New York on Monday threatened a holiday season shopping boycott after meeting with Macy's Inc Chairman Terry Lundgren to discuss accusations of racial profiling of shoppers.

column4: Boycott threatened after racial profiling claims at Macy's  Barneys
column5: NEW YORK  Nov 4 The Reverend Al Sharpton and other civil rights leaders in New York on Monday threatened a holiday season shopping boycott after meeting with Macy's Inc  Chairman Terry Lundgren to discuss accusations of racial profiling of shoppers.

column4: Marathon Oil quarterly profit up 26 percent  tops Street
column5: Marathon Oil Corp  said on Monday its third-quarter profit rose by a better-than-expected 26 percent  helped by a jump in oil and gas production.

column4: COLUMN-Why IPOs are unlikely to produce long-term gains
column5: CHICAGO  Nov. 4 As the founders and backers of Twitter move toward the ultimate tweet - an initial public offering - it's a good time to ask whether IPOs are good investments.

column4: AIG may file lawsuit against Morgan Stanley-SEC filing
column5: NEW YORK  Nov 4 American International Group Inc  may file a lawsuit against Morgan Stanley related to $3.7 billion worth of mortgage securities that the investment bank sponsored or underwrote from 2005 to 2007  and which AIG purchased  according to a regulatory filing on Monday.

column4: South Korea plans to buy four Global Hawk aircraft from 2017
column5: SEOUL South Korea intends to buy four Global Hawk unmanned aircraft  made by Northrop Grumman Corp  for about 900 billion won ($848 million)  an official at the country's defense acquisition agency confirmed on Monday.

column4: S.Korea plans to buy four Global Hawk aircraft from 2017
column5: SEOUL  Nov 4 South Korea intends to buy four Global Hawk unmanned aircraft  made by Northrop Grumman Corp   for about 900 billion won ($848 million)  an official at the country's defense acquisition agency confirmed on Monday.

column4: China sends graft busters to more provinces  govt departments
column5: BEIJING  Nov 4 China has sent anti-corruption investigators to six more provinces and four government departments  the Chinese Communist Party's corruption watchdog said on Monday  in the government's latest move to tackle graft.

column4: EMERGING MARKETS-Brazil stocks buoyed by strong China data
column5: MEXICO CITY  Nov 4 Strong economic data out of China boosted Brazilian stocks on Monday  led by gains in miner Vale and oil producer Petrobras  while investors in Mexico showed caution ahead of key data in the United States.

column4: CANADA STOCKS-Gold  Potash take TSX higher; BlackBerry pounded
column5: * TSX rises 24.32 points  or 0.18 percent  to 13 361.78     * Six of 10 main index sectors advance     * Potash has market's biggest positive influence     * BlackBerry drops 16.6 percent      By John Tilak     TORONTO  Nov 4 Canada's main stock index rose on Monday as a jump in the shares of gold miners and in Potash Corp  provided support  offsetting weakness in BlackBerry Ltd  after the smartphone maker called off a sale of the company.      Investors were also encouraged by data

column4: Suntrust to add corporate banking sites in three major U.S. cities
column5: SunTrust Banks Inc  said on Monday that it is adding corporate lending offices in Dallas  San Francisco  and Chicago as part of its strategy to turn that business into a nationally focused operation instead of a regional one.

column4: Venezuela seizing two workover rigs from U.S. company
column5: HOUSTON/CARACAS Venezuela is in the process of seizing oil equipment owned by Houston-based Superior Energy Services  a company spokesman said on Monday  after state-run PDVSA failed to pay debts owed to the U.S. company.

column4: Venezuela seizing two workover rigs from U.S. company
column5: HOUSTON/CARACAS  Nov 4 Venezuela is in the process of seizing oil equipment owned by Houston-based Superior Energy Services  a company spokesman said on Monday  after state-run PDVSA failed to pay debts owed to the U.S. company.

column4: Telefonica seeks EU okay to buy KPN's German unit
column5: BRUSSELS  Nov 4 Telefonica has asked EU antitrust regulators to clear its planned 8.6-billion-euro ($11.6 billion) takeover of KPN's German unit E-Plus  which will reinforce the Spanish telecoms provider against rivals Deutsche Telekom and Vodafone.

column4: Tenet posts lower net profit  absorbs Vanguard
column5: Tenet Healthcare Corp  said its third-quarter net income slid from a year earlier due to costs related to its acquisition of smaller hospital chain Vanguard Health Systems Inc.

column4: UPDATE 2-Tenet posts lower net profit  absorbs Vanguard
column5: Nov 4 Tenet Healthcare Corp said its third-quarter net income slid from a year earlier due to costs related to its acquisition of smaller hospital chain Vanguard Health Systems Inc.

column4: Teva asks U.S. justices for stay in Copaxone case
column5: WASHINGTON  Nov 4 Teva Pharmaceutical Industries on Monday asked the U.S. Supreme Court to stay an appeals court ruling that would strip its $4 billion-a-year multiple sclerosis drug Copaxone of its patent protection in 2014 rather than 2015.

column4: UPDATE 1-Velti to sell businesses to Blackstone  US ops file for bankruptcy
column5: Nov 4 Ireland's Velti Plc said it would sell its mobile marketing business in the United States  Britain and India to a unit of Blackstone Group LP  and that it had filed for bankruptcy under Chapter 11 for its remaining U.S. operations.

column4: Blackstone  ICBC unit to buy stakes in China shopping mall operator
column5: HONG KONG  Nov 4 Global private equity firm Blackstone Group has agreed to buy a 40 percent stake in Chinese shopping mall operator and developer SCP Co Ltd for an undisclosed value  SCP said in a statement on Monday.

column4: Weatherford beats profit view  settles U.S. corruption charges
column5: Nov 4 Oil services company Weatherford  on Monday reported higher-than-expected earnings and the finalization of deals with the U.S. government on various longstanding charges that will cost it around $250 million.

column4: Australia shares turn lower  hurt by Westpac  Fed uncertainty
column5: SYDNEY  Nov 4 Australian shares reversed earlier gains to fall 0.4 percent on Monday as selling in major lender Westpac and uncertainty over the U.S. Federal Reserve's stimulus programme offset better-than-expected retail sales and house price figures.

column4: US STOCKS-Wall St gains modestly after data; BlackBerry plummets
column5: NEW YORK  Nov 4 U.S. stocks edged modestly higher on Monday in the wake of data showing that business spending dropped sharply in September and amid uncertainty over how soon the Federal Reserve would be comfortable enough with growth to begin scaling back stimulus.

column4: US STOCKS-Wall St set to rise at open; BlackBerry plummets
column5: NEW YORK  Nov 4 U.S. stocks were set for a higher open on Monday  putting the S&P 500 on track to build on its latest record high after four straight weeks of gains.

column4: Williams adds more Marcellus gas into service in U.S. Northeast
column5: NEW YORK  Nov 4 Williams Partners LP on Monday said the remaining natural gas supply on its Transco Northeast Supply Link entered service on Friday  bringing additional gas from the Marcellus Shale to market.

column4: Johnson leads Chase after win at Texas
column5: FORT WORTH  Texas -- Jimmie Johnson took a giant step toward his sixth NASCAR Sprint Cup championship by dominating Sunday's AAA Texas 500 at Texas Motor Speedway.
